value.name: SARAH VINE: Who the hell creates an online game in which your avatar can be raped?
value.description: After various baffling attempts to block it on 'free speech' grounds, we finally have a framework that can protect children and young people from the worst excesses of the internet.

value.name: Burger King worker who got 'insulting' gift after never missing a shift buys dream home
value.description: Kevin Ford, a cook at a Burger King in Las Vegas, went viral last year after he received a 'goody' bag from his managers to celebrate never missing a shift in 27 years

value.name: ITV Dancing On Ice bosses bracing for 'clash' as Hannah Spearitt and Rachel Stevens to be 'kept apart'
value.description: Former S Club star Hannah Spearitt faces competition on ITV Dancing On Ice from professional Brendyn Hattfield - the boyfriend of her ex-bandmate Rachel Stevens

value.description: Liberal Democrat leader Sir Ed Davey is campaigning in Conservative constituencies held by ministers Jeremy Hunt and Michael Gove.

value.name: Live news: Trump sues over Maine ballot rejection
value.description: Donald Trump has filed a lawsuit to reinstate his name on Maine’s presidential primary ballot. US stocks declined in the first session of the year, while Treasury yields surged as traders moderated expectations for interest rate cuts.

value.name: Nigel Farage is doing a great job, says Tory chief Lee Anderson
value.description: As the Brexit champion ponders a return to frontline politics with Reform, the Conservative deputy chairman admits his party could be outflanked on the right

value.name: Camden Council vets businesses seeking contracts over their commitment to 'LGBTQ+ values'
value.description: The Labour-run council will now only work 'with businesses whose values align with our own' and which 'positively influence' social attitudes within its electoral wards.

value.name: The accidental icon: The fascinating history of how the FTSE 100 was created 40 years ago today
value.description: The low-key switch-on of a computer programme on January 3, 1984 heralded the birth of one of the UK's most recognisable business brands.

value.name: Laurence Fox issues message as he ponders another run at becoming London Mayor
value.description: The anti-woke warrior said he refuses to "stand by and watch the city I live in and love be destroyed before our eyes".

value.description: Saleh Arouri was a founder of the group’s military wing and the most senior figure killed since the war with Israel began.

value.name: The optimistic case for the British economy
value.description: The UK economy shrank in the third quarter of last year, putting it on the cusp of a recession. It is expected to grow by about half a per cent in both 2023 and 2024 as the impact of high interest rates and elevated price levels squeeze households and businesses.

value.name: Hamas deputy leader Saleh al-Arouri killed in Beirut blast
value.description: The deputy head of Hamas, the Palestinian group which rules Gaza, has been killed in a blast in Lebanon, a senior Hamas official has told the BBC. Local media said Saleh al-Arouri was killed in an Israeli drone attack in the south of the capital, Beirut.

value.name: Survivors and victims’ commissioner directly links bereaved payments report to passage of UK Government’s legacy act
value.description: Outgoing victims’ and survivors commissioner Ian Jeffers on Tuesday directly linked his proposal for payments to all those bereaved during the conflict to the UK Government’s legacy act.

value.name: Turkey detains 34 on suspicion of spying for Israel
value.description: Turkey says it has seized 34 people who are alleged to have been involved in spying and planning abductions for Israel's Mossad intelligence agency. Officials said 57 addresses were raided in Istanbul and elsewhere and they were still searching for 12 more suspects.

value.name: What is behind Turkey's staunch support for Hamas in Gaza?

value.name: UK factory slump deepens as European demand wanes
value.description: The UK’s manufacturing downturn deepened further at the end of the year and business confidence sank to a 12 month-low, according to a new survey. The S&P Global/CIPS UK manufacturing PMI survey fell from 47.2 in November to 46.2 in December. The score remains below the 50.0 threshold, which indicates that the sector is contracting.

value.name: UK Economy Will Remain Gloomy in 2024
value.description: The UK economy will enter ‘grey gloom’ until polling day, according to the FT’s annual survey. A majority of the 90 respondents to the FT’s annual poll of leading UK-based economists said despite falling inflation voters would feel little improvement in their living standards before the general election expected this year.

value.name: First UK maritime shipment of aid for Gaza arrives in Egypt
value.description: The first UK maritime shipment of aid for Gaza has arrived in Egypt, carrying almost 90 tonnes of thermal blankets and other essential items. The shipment was delivered from Cyprus by Royal Fleet Auxiliary ship Lyme Bay, carrying thermal blankets, shelter packs and medical supplies provided by the UK and the Republic of Cyprus.

value.name: Italian outcry as MP Pozzolo's gun wounds man at New Year's Eve party
value.description: A shot that lightly wounded a man at a New Year's Eve party has prompted an angry political response after it emerged it was fired from a gun owned by an Italian far-right MP. Emanuele Pozzolo, a member of Prime Minister Georgia Meloni's Brothers of Italy party, admitted bringing the gun but denied firing the shot.

value.description: The FTSE 100 index closed down 11.72 points, 0.2%, at 7,721.52. The FTSE 250 ended down 177.83 points, 0.9%, at 19,511.80, and the AIM All-Share closed down 1.77 points, or 0.2%, at 761.55.

value.name: What is behind Turkey's staunch support for Hamas in Gaza?
value.description: Turkey has stepped up support for Gaza since 7 October, for example bringing dozens of patients from Gaza to Turkey for treatment. Turkey's health minister himself accompanied the casualties en route from Egypt.

value.name: Staveley council hopes Chesterfield MP will support them instead of putting their future in doubt
value.description: Financially-troubled Staveley Town Council which has been making ‘significant progress’ with its recovery has urged Chesterfield MP Toby Perkins to ‘join the local community’ in supporting them after he has brought the authority’s future into question.

value.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer are both set to make public appearances this week.

value.name: Politics latest news: Number of asylum seekers removed from UK drops by half
value.description: James Cleverly has defended the Government over its claim to have delivered on Rishi Sunak’s pledge of clearing a backlog of asylum claims . Mr Sunak pledged in December 2022 to “abolish” the backlog of more than 91,000 outstanding “legacy” asylum cases older than June 2022 by the end of 2023.

value.description: EXCLUSIVE: The deputy leader of Reform UK accused the former PM of 'being in bed with Bahrain and Saudi Arabia'.

value.name: UK factory slump deepens as European demand wanes
value.description: The UK’s manufacturing downturn deepened further at the end of the year and business confidence sank to a 12 month-low, according to a new survey. The S&P Global/CIPS UK manufacturing PMI survey fell from 47.2 in November to 46.2 in December. The score remains below the 50.0 threshold, which indicates that the sector is contracting.

value.name: UK Economy Will Remain Gloomy in 2024
value.description: The UK economy will enter ‘grey gloom’ until polling day, according to the FT’s annual survey. A majority of the 90 respondents to the FT’s annual poll of leading UK-based economists said despite falling inflation voters would feel little improvement in their living standards before the general election expected this year.

value.name: Nearly 30,000 migrants crossed Channel to UK last year
value.description: Nearly 30,000 migrants crossed the Channel from mainland Europe to Britain in small boats in 2023, an annual drop of more than a third, according to government figures released on Monday.

value.name: First UK maritime shipment of aid for Gaza arrives in Egypt
value.description: The first UK maritime shipment of aid for Gaza has arrived in Egypt, carrying almost 90 tonnes of thermal blankets and other essential items. The shipment was delivered from Cyprus by Royal Fleet Auxiliary ship Lyme Bay, carrying thermal blankets, shelter packs and medical supplies provided by the UK and the Republic of Cyprus.

value.name: Italian outcry as MP Pozzolo's gun wounds man at New Year's Eve party
value.description: A shot that lightly wounded a man at a New Year's Eve party has prompted an angry political response after it emerged it was fired from a gun owned by an Italian far-right MP. Emanuele Pozzolo, a member of Prime Minister Georgia Meloni's Brothers of Italy party, admitted bringing the gun but denied firing the shot.
